Sentencas: A coupling system composed of a high temperature fuel cell such as a molten carbonate fuel cell (MCFC), a regenerator, and a thermoradiative cell (TRC) is established.
Titulo: Optimum operation states and parametric selection criteria of a high temperature fuel cell-thermoradiative cell system

Sentencas: The efficiency and power output of the coupling system are analytically derived.
Titulo: Optimum operation states and parametric selection criteria of a high temperature fuel cell-thermoradiative cell system

Sentencas: The performances of the system are evaluated.
Titulo: Optimum operation states and parametric selection criteria of a high temperature fuel cell-thermoradiative cell system

Sentencas: The optimum operation states of the system are determined.
Titulo: Optimum operation states and parametric selection criteria of a high temperature fuel cell-thermoradiative cell system

Sentencas: The optimal selection criteria of some key parameters are provided.
Titulo: Optimum operation states and parametric selection criteria of a high temperature fuel cell-thermoradiative cell system

Sentencas: It is found that when the MCFC is operated at the temperature of 923 K and the band gap of the TRC equals 0.2 eV, the maximum power output density (MPOD) of the coupling system is approximately 2.020 times of that of a single MCFC and the corresponding efficiency of the coupling system is approximately 1.304 times of that of the MCFC.
Titulo: Optimum operation states and parametric selection criteria of a high temperature fuel cell-thermoradiative cell system

Sentencas: The percentage improvements of the MPODs of the coupling system and other MCFC-based coupling systems in the existing literatures are compared.
Titulo: Optimum operation states and parametric selection criteria of a high temperature fuel cell-thermoradiative cell system

Sentencas: The results show that the MCFC-TRC coupling system can exhibit better performance and make use of the waste heat released by the MCFC more effectively in comparison with other MCFC-based coupling systems.
Titulo: Optimum operation states and parametric selection criteria of a high temperature fuel cell-thermoradiative cell system

Sentencas: Moreover, it is expounded that the TRC is an efficient device which can recycle and utilize the waste heat produced by other high temperature fuel cells such as solid oxide fuel cells and direct carbon fuel cells.
Titulo: Optimum operation states and parametric selection criteria of a high temperature fuel cell-thermoradiative cell system
